facts.fact: 2.35 Million cars in Australia were affected by defective Takata airbags.  A CHOICE investigation revealed that major manufacturers including Honda, Toyota, Lexus, BMW and Mazda failed to inform consumers about their safety
CHOICE testing found that Cuddly Sensitive Hypoallergenic fabric softener performed worse than water and cost 3000x as much.
Poorly labeled pet food can harm your cat.  We found that misleading labels on Coles cat food could lead to your cat not getting a 'complete' diet.
Gummy kids vitamin suplements were being marketed as good for kids teeth while having as much sugar as regular confectionary
CHOICE received hundreds of complaints about Viagogo's dodgy ticket sales website.
Getting in the habit of saving early is a good thing, but we think Westpac went too far by targeting unborn babies with a below average product
We tested a Samsung washer drier combo that uses a huge 149 litres of fresh drinking water to remove three litres of water from our 3.5kg test load and took 6.5Hrs to run
We found that the Pain Erazor's claims were baseless and the device would be better for lighting a gas stovetop than relieving pain
Everyone loves a holiday, but CHOICE analysis found that popular timeshare schemes had contract terms up to 40 years and could cost over $450,000
The Commonwealth Bank's Dollarmites scheme has been using subversive sales tactics under the guise of educating our children
Magnetic therapy blankets are sold for humans and pets to relieve pain.  We think all they releave relieve you of is the money from your wallet
Bioglan's homeopathic cures are being sold in thousands of pharmacies and supermarkets based on murky claims and without evidence.
Nutri-Grain's To-Go breakfast pouches are high in sugar, low in nutrition and cost more than traditional breakfast products
The KitchenAid 2-Slice toaster had only one job to do.  It even looks like a toaster, why can't it toast bread?
The KitchenAid 2-Slice toaster had only one job to do.  It even looks like a toaster, why can't it toast bread?
Read about catch-22 pet insurance whose conditions make it worthless
CHOICE's analysis of Medibank private health insurance policies uncover some surprising rip offs
Kogan is a popular online retailer, but can you return a defective product?
Ikea's Nedkyld fridge is one of the worst performing fridges we have tested.  Find out why.
Freedom Foods XO Crunch gives itself a 4/5 Health Star rating, but is full of sugar and targeting kids
Finance giant AMP's superannuation division grosly underperforms on satisfaction and returns, affecting 55.5% of Australian workers
